com.momoko.es.jpa

Class MomokoService<U extends AbstractUser<U,ID>,ID extends Serializable>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.momoko.es.jpa.MomokoService<U,ID>

  • @Validated
 @Transactional(propagation=SUPPORTS,
               readOnly=true)
public abstract class MomokoService<U extends AbstractUser<U,ID>,ID extends Serializable>
extends Object
    The Momoko Service class
    Author:
    Sanjay Patel

      • newUser

        public abstract U newUser()
        Creates a new user object. Must be overridden in the subclass, like this: 
         public User newUser() {
    return new User();
 }

      • getContext

        public Map<String,Object> getContext(Optional<Long> expirationMillis,
                                     javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response)
        Returns the context data to be sent to the client, i.e. reCaptchaSiteKey and all the properties prefixed with momoko.shared. To send custom properties, put those in your application properties in the format momoko.shared.fooBar. If a user is logged in, it also returns the user data and a new authorization token. If expirationMillis is not provided, the expiration of the new token is set to the default. Override this method if needed.
